page.title: 03HERONTYRE ESTATE
page.content: The whole of N.Sussex and S.Surrey has had to cope with an increased population of over 120,000.Our area has had to find new dwellings for over 8,000.In 1970 it was decided to build an estate on some rough grazing land previously belonging to the Herontyre Estate.A plan was produced in Oct.1973 which put aside 149 acres for 3,900 people and 80 acres for 2,300.This plan was accepted by the government. A main distributor road was the backbone of the plan, joining Lewes Road with Dunnings Road.No building was allowed until "adequate access roads" were built.Building was meant to finish in 1978 but a new area was started in 1984-the Lower Mere estate.
